channel.title: Krystian Safjan's Blog
channel.description: Data Scientist and Team Leader writing about Machine Learning, MLOps, and Python

item.title: RAG Evaluation with RAGAS and MLflow - A Practical Guide
item.description: A comprehensive tutorial demonstrating RAG evaluation using RAGAS metrics through MLflow integration. Learn to build a minimal RAG pipeline with LangChain, create golden evaluation datasets, and systematically assess retrieval quality using Faithfulness, Context Precision, Context Recall, and Factual Correctness metrics. Supports OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, and Ollama backends.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Working Faster with Git Worktrees and AI-Based Multi-Workflow Development
item.description: A practical, hands-on guide to turning a single codebase into a multi-workflow environment using Git worktrees, VS Code, and AI coding assistants. The tutorial shows how to isolate experiments, compare results, and speed up refactoring work with agents and Copilot.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Using Git Worktrees as Clean Rooms for AI-Assisted Coding
item.description: Learn how Git worktrees create isolated environments for AI-assisted coding, allowing you to keep your main development line clean while experimenting with AI suggestions in dedicated branches.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Avoiding Homebrew Upgrades That Require Sudo on macOS
item.description: Learn how to manage Homebrew upgrades on macOS to avoid sudo prompts, by differentiating between formulae and casks and using specific commands like --formula, --cask, and pinning problematic packages.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Understanding Python Protocols - Structural Subtyping in Practice
item.description: Learn how Python protocols using structural subtyping in PEP 544 allow for flexible, decoupled code by defining shapes through method signatures rather than class inheritance. Explore examples of implementing read-only attributes and optional methods within protocols.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Evolution of Type Hints in Python — From Comments to Inline Typing and Beyond
item.description: Learn about the evolution of type hints in Python, from initial comments to modern inline typing and key features introduced in each major version, enabling powerful static type checking with tools like mypy and pyright.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Keeping performance results in a separate Git branch using `git checkout --orphan`
item.description: Learn how to use git checkout --orphan to create a separate Git branch with no history, ideal for storing performance results or other generated content independently from your codebase. Discover the process and benefits of using orphan branches, including an example GitHub Actions workflow for publishing test results.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Understanding the Language Server Protocol through a Minimal Working Example
item.description: Learn how the Language Server Protocol standardizes communication between code editors and language servers, enabling editors like VS Code to request features such as diagnostics and completions from a single server, simplifying development workflows.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Using CSS Variables for Dynamic and Reusable Styling
item.description: Learn how to use CSS variables for dynamic and reusable styling, enabling features like interactive UIs, easy theming, and design consistency across components. Discover practical usage examples and best practices while understanding limitations and browser support issues.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Bare Asterisk in Python Function Signatures - Keyword Only Arguments
item.description: Learn how to use the bare asterisk in Python function signatures to enforce keyword-only arguments, enhancing clarity and preventing argument order bugs in your code.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Six Weeks, Real Progress - Exploring Shape Up for Product Work
item.description: Shape Up offers a focused alternative to sprint-driven development, trading constant ceremonies and tight iterations for clear boundaries and six-week cycles. This article explores when it works well, when it doesn’t, and why it may help teams overwhelmed by process overhead.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Simpler Parallelism with concurrent.futures
item.description: Learn how to simplify parallel and concurrent programming in Python using concurrent.futures, including executors for managing threads and processes, and futures for handling task results.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Threading vs Multiprocessing in Python - GIL Implications and Choosing the Right Tool
item.description: Learn about the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) and how threading and multiprocessing in Python differ, with examples showing that multiprocessing is better for CPU-bound tasks due to GIL limitations.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: asyncio Basics - async/await and When to Actually Use Them
item.description: Learn how async/await enables efficient concurrent programming by handling I/O waits without blocking, and discover various ways to run tasks concurrently, manage context managers, and handle timeouts.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Replacing Makefile with Invoke for Cross-Platform Python Tasks
item.description: Learn how switching from Make to Invoke improves cross-platform compatibility for Python project tasks, ensuring consistent behavior across macOS, Linux, and Windows.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Using OpenAI Python SDK with Local Ollama Models (and When to Opt for Alternatives)
item.description: Learn how to use the official openai Python package with local Ollama models and when it's better to opt for LiteLLM as a more unified alternative.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Building a Multi-Notebook Report with Quarto
item.description: Learn how to split a large Jupyter notebook into multiple notebooks and combine them into a cohesive report using Quarto's book project functionality for HTML, PDF, or EPUB formats.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Downgrade or Upgrade Your Python Version with uv
item.description: Learn how to downgrade or upgrade your project’s Python version using the uv tool, including steps for installing, pinning, and recreating your virtual environment.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Beyond Coverage - Building Truly Complete Test Suites with GitHub Copilot
item.description: This article explores how to move beyond simplistic code coverage metrics to build truly comprehensive test suites using GitHub Copilot. Drawing from practical experience, I demonstrate how AI-assisted testing can identify behavioral gaps, validate API contracts, generate maintainable tests, and address flaky tests - ultimately creating a sustainable quality assurance strategy focused on behaviors rather than coverage percentages. Learn specific techniques for behavioral auditing, integration testing, and continuous quality monitoring that have transformed our approach to software reliability.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Understanding Python's `copy` vs `deepcopy` - When to Use Each
item.description: Learn when to use copy.copy() for shallow copying and copy.deepcopy() for deep copying in Python, understanding their differences and typical use cases.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Tracking Down zsh Alias Plugin Sources
item.description: Learn how to trace and identify the source of zsh aliases defined by plugins using verbose tracing and grep, enabling you to pinpoint exactly where custom aliases are created.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Guide to Managing VS Code Keyboard Shortcuts
item.description: Learn how VS Code handles context-dependent keyboard shortcuts, resolve conflicts using the Keyboard Shortcuts editor, and customize them for efficient coding.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Simple In-Memory Knowledge Graphs for Quick Graph Querying
item.description: As developers, we often reach for full-scale graph databases when simpler solutions would suffice. When your knowledge graph is modest in size, keeping it in memory can be both efficient and practical. Let's explore some powerful tools that make this approach work beautifully.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Quick Ways to Disable GitHub Actions Workflows Without Deletion
item.description: Learn three quick methods to temporarily disable GitHub Actions workflows without deleting them, including commenting out code, using manual triggers, and adding conditional logic.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Pandas Categorical - Benefits and Use Cases
item.description: Learn about the memory efficiency, improved performance, meaningful order, type safety, and faster groupby operations with pandas Categorical data type, especially beneficial for large datasets with limited unique values.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Audio Notifications in Jupyter Notebooks Across Platforms
item.description: Learn how to implement sound notifications in Jupyter notebooks using the cross-platform beepy package and native macOS commands like say and afplay for enhanced productivity.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Notes on using ripgrep for projects with python, jupyter (ipynb) notebooks and markdown files
item.description: Learn how to effectively use ripgrep (rg) for searching Python, Jupyter notebook (.ipynb), and Markdown (.md) files with various options like file type specificity, context display, and pattern matching.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: VSCode problem - import could not be resolved from the source (Pylance)
item.description: Learn how to resolve the "Import 'pandas' could not be resolved from the source" warning in VSCode's Jupyter notebook using Pylance by ensuring the correct Python interpreter and virtual environment are activated.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: How to Remove Diacritics and Sanitize Strings in Python
item.description: Learn how to easily remove diacritics and sanitize strings in Python using the unidecode library, enabling better search functionality and data normalization for international text.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan

item.title: Implementing Sentence Boundary Detection in Python for Improved Text Chunking
item.description: Learn how to implement sentence boundary detection using spaCy in Python, including handling edge cases and preprocessing techniques for more accurate text chunking.
item.dc:creator: Krystian Safjan
